abstract: Under fire over executive pay, Verizon announced plans to put its compensation plans to an annual vote by shareholders, starting with its general meeting in 2009.
snippet: Under fire over executive pay, Verizon announced plans to put its compensation plans to an annual vote by shareholders, starting with its general meeting in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Directors at Verizon Communications, under fire from shareholders over executive pay practices, said yesterday that they would put the company’s compensation plans to an annual vote by investors beginning at its general meeting in 2009.

headline.main: Verizon to Put Executive Pay to Shareholder Vote
headline.print_headline: Verizon Shareholders to Vote On Pay for Top Executives

abstract: Directors at Verizon Communications, under fire from shareholders over executive pay practices, said Thursday that they would put the company’s compensation plans to an annual vote by investors beginning at its general meeting in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Directors at Verizon Communications, under fire from shareholders over executive pay practices, said Thursday that they would put the company’s compensation plans to an annual vote by investors beginning at its general meeting in 2009.

headline.main: Verizon to Put Executive Pay to Shareholder Vote
